title: Bug 3666CodeCompletion  Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description: Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add aparameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the codeassist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to controlthe amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option.
OB: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in the software eats too much code. In this specific case, the baz call in the bar method of the provided class is modified to add an additional parameter, which is necessary for the program to be correct.
EB: The code should be changed to: baz(x.foo().foo()) instead of baz(x.foo()). I would rather have the code assist provide baz(x.foo()x.foo()).
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Change the baz call to baz(x.x.foo()) in the provided class. 2. Place the cursor after the first "x.". 3. Press CtrlSpace to bring up code assist. 4. Type "f" to filter the list. 5. Select "foo()" from the list.
